result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley J Peters

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered. 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Bradley J Peters in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.


Court orders the following:
Fine:  $379
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives - DNA previously provided.
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
To be paid in full by:  08/05/16
Alternate:  6 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Bradley J Peters in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  
Defense still waiting on a response from the State.
If not resolved on the next court date, matter will be set for trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
